content.description: The height of a point on a dolphin swimming in the ocean can be modeled by a sinusoidal function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>. For time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math>, in seconds, if <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is positive, the point on the dolphin is above the surface of the water, and if <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></math> is negative, the point on the dolphin is below the surface of the water. As the dolphin swims, it jumps to a maximum height of <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> feet above the surface, then hits the surface, and dives to a minimum height of <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> feet below the surface. The dolphin then returns to the surface, and jumps to a maximum height of <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> feet above the surface. This cycle from maximum height to the next maximum height repeats every <math alttext="4"> <mn>4</mn> </math> seconds.
content.question: Which of the following could be an expression for <math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses"> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> </math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 sin open parentheses pi over 2 t close parentheses"><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="3 sin open parentheses pi t close parentheses"><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>
<math alttext="sin open parentheses pi over 2 t close parentheses plus 3"><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>
<math alttext="sin open parentheses pi t close parentheses plus 3"><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3 sin open parentheses pi over 2 t close parentheses"><mn>3</mn><mi>sin</mi><mfenced><mrow><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>
